info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 3:25PM MDT until September 13 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of Colorado, including the following counties, Montrose and San Miguel and southeast Utah, including the following county, San Juan.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.6 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Gypsum Creek, Coyote Wash, Little Gypsum Creek and Dolores River. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern San Miguel, Southwestern Montrose and Northeastern San Juan Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Montrose, CO; San Miguel, CO; San Juan, UT
